job description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst

Location:
1405 N. 98th St
Kansas City, Kansas, 66111
United States
Company: Dairy Farmers of America, Inc
Req Num: req7131

Job Description

Expand DFA’s enterprise data access architecture and information delivery systems. Analyze, design, develop, and provide operational support skills to deliver business intelligence, data warehousing, reporting, and visualization solutions for a wide range of business functions and user communities.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Design, develop, and deploy logical or physical data models that support information delivery and data visualization needs
  • Acquire data from multiple sources and transform in to reporting ready data marts
  • Create technical specifications for data flows and transformation
  • Develop content using established standards
  • Create and execute test scripts with business reporting analysts
  • Ensure data quality with user and regression testing
  • Deliver data models using agile development releases
  • Coordinate change management with ETL Specialist
  • Maintain outbound interfaces using API, FTP, email, etc.
  • Test new technologies to assist the company in becoming a data driven organization
  • The requirements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employee, but is not a complete list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required. Other duties may be assigned as required.

    Requirements

    Education and Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Data Science
  • 4-6 years of experience as a Data Warehouse/BI developer, which includes experience with SQL and data profiling using MS Sql Server; Microsoft reporting tools such as SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS; and Master Data Management
  • Certifications and/or Licenses – N/A
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Dimensional data modeling and design expertise in an enterprise data warehousing environment
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and dimensional data modeling
  • Ability to work in agile development process
  • Ability to use data to create models that depict trends
  • Understanding of analytical concepts for reporting and troubleshooting
  • Ability to co-ordinate data modeling, ETL development, and testing activities
  • Ability to quickly learn and apply new processes and technologies
  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to balance multiple tasks with high attention to details
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to articulate and document processes and workflows
EEO/AA/Female/Minority/Disabled/Veteran

EEO/AA/Female/Minority/Disabled/Veteran
